title: Space Development Agency to consider commercial LEO options to augment DoD network
summary: SpaceX, Kuiper Government Solutions and Aalyria Technologies were selected for market-research studies on how commercial systems could add capacity to the military’s future low Earth orbit constellation.

title: HyImpulse to Debut SR75 Rocket No Earlier than December 1
summary:
A launch license approved by the UK Civil Aviation Authority on 28 July grants HyImpulse permission to launch its SR75 rocket for the first time from SaxaVord Spaceport in Scotland between 1 December 2023 and 30 November 2024. The single-stage suborbital SR75 rocket is powered by one of the company’s HyPLOX-75 hybrid rocket motors which […]
The post HyImpulse to Debut SR75 Rocket No Earlier than December 1 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Investing in Space: A guide to satellites
summary: Last year I wrote about the key terms investors should know about the steps involved in a rocket launch, to give a guide for what phrases mean in context.

title: UK defense contractor BAE buying Ball’s aerospace division for $5.6 billion
summary: Ball Corporation agreed to sell its aerospace division to U.K. defense contractor BAE Systems for $5.6 billion in cash, the companies announced on Thursday.

title: Northrop Grumman to get sole-source contract for Space Force radar sites
summary: The U.S. Space Force intends to award Northrop Grumman a sole-source contract to develop two ground-based radar sites to track space objects.

title: BAE Systems to acquire Ball Aerospace for $5.5 billion
summary: BAE Systems, a defense and security conglomerate based in the United Kingdom, announced Aug. 17 it intends to acquire Ball Aerospace for $5.5 billion.

title: Terran Orbital expects $180 million payment from Rivada Space this year
summary: Terran Orbital expects to get $180 million this year from Rivada Space as it prepares to build 300 satellites for the venture, even as plans to fund the full $2.4 billion manufacturing contract remain under wraps.

title: State Department Kicks Off International Lunar Year Discussions
summary: The State Department is starting discussions with U.S. stakeholders to organize an International Lunar Year. The ILY will build on the International Geophysical Year that heralded the beginning of the […]

title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-6 to Discuss Space Station Mission, Upcoming Return
summary: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-6 will answer media questions at 2:40 p.m. EDT Wednesday, Aug. 23, about their mission aboard International Space Station prior to returning to Earth.

title: NASA Hosts Astronaut Loral O’Hara’s Prelaunch Interviews
summary: NASA astronaut Loral O'Hara will virtually discuss her upcoming mission to the International Space Station during live interviews ahead of launch.
